pullrequest.title: Tutorial for installing on ubuntu on windows (WSL)

content.raw: Thanks @{557058:b5298278-299c-4d16-b5aa-449d6d2db98d} ! In any case, fortunately a few quirks that used to be present are not present anymore thanks to changes in Gazebo or in WSL, see [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2351/gazebo-issues-on-windows-subsystem-for](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2351/gazebo-issues-on-windows-subsystem-for) . The only two things that we currently document for users that want to use Gazebo on WSL are the use of a Xserver and the need to sanitize the PATH \(see [https://github.com/robotology/robotology-superbuild/tree/v2020.02#windows-subsystem-for-linux](https://github.com/robotology/robotology-superbuild/tree/v2020.02#windows-subsystem-for-linux)\) but  those are not Gazebo-specific in any way, so it may be not necessary to have a dedicated piece of documentation to describe how to use Gazebo on WSL.
content.html: Thanks @Peter Mitrano ! In any case, fortunately a few quirks that used to be present are not present anymore thanks to changes in Gazebo or in WSL, see https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2351/gazebo-issues-on-windows-subsystem-for . The only two things that we currently document for users that want to use Gazebo on WSL are the use of a Xserver and the need to sanitize the PATH (see https://github.com/robotology/robotology-superbuild/tree/v2020.02#windows-subsystem-for-linux) but those are not Gazebo-specific in any way, so it may be not necessary to have a dedicated piece of documentation to describe how to use Gazebo on WSL.

content.raw: Sorry I don’t think I still have it. I deleted the fork of Gazebo a while ago that had this.
content.html: Sorry I don’t think I still have it. I deleted the fork of Gazebo a while ago that had this.

content.raw: @{557058:b5298278-299c-4d16-b5aa-449d6d2db98d} \+1 . If you have the code it would be good to store it somewhere.
content.html: @Peter Mitrano +1 . If you have the code it would be good to store it somewhere.

content.html:
@peter_mitrano the PR was deleted, it was intentional?

Despite never being merged, this PR was a great place to point people that were asking how to run Gazebo on WSL.
Shame on me for not backing it up somewhere more stable.
